Package domain

Class MagicAction

extends java.lang.Object

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void activate​(int magicKeyCode)
      Activates an Activatable object corresponding to the magicKeyCode if it is legal.
      void addMagic​(int i)
      Updates the hashmap that holds the current magic counts and the constant value correspondingly.
      void fire()
      Adds two Hex objects to the hex list of the Paddle object.
      static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Boolean> getCurrentMagicsAndActivations()  
      Activatable getMagic​(int magicKeyCode)
      Finds the corresponding magic from the hashmap, checks whether the player has remaining, checks whether the selected magic is already active or not, and checks the magicKeyCode is legal.
      static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> getMagics()  
      void initializeMagics()
      Calls the magic factory to initialize the magics as 0 for the constructor and initializes all the magics as false which means that all of them are deactive.
      boolean repOk()
      Checks whether the MagicAction rep is OK or not: - Checks the ChanceGiving remaining is 0 or not.
      static void setCurrentMagicsAndActivations​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Boolean> currentMagicsAndActivations)  
      static void setMagics​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> magics)

    • Constructor Detail

      • MagicAction

        public MagicAction()

    • Method Detail

      • initializeMagics

        public void initializeMagics()
        Calls the magic factory to initialize the magics as 0 for the constructor and initializes all the magics as false which means that all of them are deactive.

      • activate

        public void activate​(int magicKeyCode)
        Activates an Activatable object corresponding to the magicKeyCode if it is legal.
        Parameters:
        magicKeyCode - a number which represents an Activatable object

      • getMagic

        public Activatable getMagic​(int magicKeyCode)
        Finds the corresponding magic from the hashmap, checks whether the player has remaining, checks whether the selected magic is already active or not, and checks the magicKeyCode is legal. If the player has the selected magic and it is not active, it returns the selected Activatable object.
        Parameters:
        magicKeyCode - a number which represents an Activatable object
        Returns:
        selected Activatable object

      • addMagic

        public void addMagic​(int i)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Updates the hashmap that holds the current magic counts and the constant value correspondingly. If the selected magic is a ChanceGivingAbility, whose key code is 0, it does not update the hashmap and constant value.
        Parameters:
        i - a number which represents an Activatable object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • fire

        public void fire()
        Adds two Hex objects to the hex list of the Paddle object.

      • repOk

        public boolean repOk()
        Checks whether the MagicAction rep is OK or not: - Checks the ChanceGiving remaining is 0 or not. - Checks the magics HashMap keys are valid or not. - Checks the ChanceGiving activation situation is false or not. - Checks the currentMagicsAndActivations HashMap keys are valid or not.

      • getCurrentMagicsAndActivations

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Boolean> getCurrentMagicsAndActivations()

      • setCurrentMagicsAndActivations

        public static void setCurrentMagicsAndActivations​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Boolean> currentMagicsAndActivations)

      • getMagics

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> getMagics()

      • setMagics

        public static void setMagics​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> magics)
